gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Inferred Connections for Selected Subsurface Dye Traces in Southern Indiana: Indiana, 2002

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: KARST_DYE_LINES_IN is a line shapefile that shows inferred subsurface connections between input and detection points of various dye-trace investigations in southern Indiana. This shapefile should be used in conjunction with an associated shapefile named KARST_DYE_PTS_IN, which shows input, output, and intermediate dye-trace points.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: KARST_DYE_LINES_IN was derived from a coverage named DYE_LINE. The purpose of DYE_LINE was to compile unpublished work maps of Samuel S. Frushour (Indiana Geological Survey) and to bring those maps to publication by IGS.

A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from this data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and (or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcView 3.2 shapefile format, approximately 17 Kb

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: KARST_DYE_LINES_IN shows inferred connections between input and detection locations that were used during selected subsurface water-movement traces. The lines represent only the general direction of flow and do not represent actual underground stream courses. For each investigation, outputs may also have occurred at locations which were not being monitored. Unsuccessful attempts to trace subsurface water movement (when dyes were injected but never detected) are not shown. Also, additional traces are known to exist that are not shown.
KARST_DYE_LINES_IN does not contain any internal attributes.

No records exist regarding horizontal positional accuracy of this shapefile. The coordinates used in georeferencing DYE_LINE (the predecessor of KARST_DYE_LINES_IN) were derived from a coverage named DYE_PTS. No quantitative tests were performed.
The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of KARST_DYE_LINES_IN.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: DYE_LINE (the predecessor of KARST_DYE_LINES_IN) was created by drawing arcs and snapping their endpoints to input and associated output points in an associated coverage named DYE_PTS.

The original coverage, DYE_LINE, was reprojected using NAD83. This coverage was then clipped to another coverage named INCLP83, a boundary coverage for the state of Indiana (compiled at a scale of 1:24,000). The resulting shapefile was named KARST_DYE_LINES_IN.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
Unpublished full-size xerographic copies of 1:24,000 topographic quadrangle maps on which input, detection, and intermediate points of selected subsurface dye-trace investigations had been plotted.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Selected Subsurface Dye Traces in Parts of South-Central Indiana

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: KARST_DYE_LINES_IN was compiled from unpublished work maps provided by Samuel S. Frushour (Indiana Geological Survey).

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
